Data Processing Modules

Functions for loading and plotting raw data

class u_shaped_lib.load_data.DshSpectrum(path, path_bg=None, center=0)[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a DSH spectrum

__init__(path, path_bg=None, center=0)[source]

Makes instance of a DSH spectrum. It is possible to pass two spectra where the second spectrum is treated as a background spectrum which is subtracted from the first.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path to DSH spectrum

  • path_bg (str, optional) – Path to background spectrum, by default None

  • center (int, optional) – Shift of the frequency axis in MHz. Set this to the value of the EOM modulation frequency (typically 80 MHz) to center the spectrum about 0. Set to 0 by default

Return type:

None

set_center(new_center)[source]

Change value of center

Parameters:

new_center (float) – New center value

get_data(path)[source]

Returns esa data from file path. This function works on data from O:Tech_PhotonicsProjectsNarrow LinewidthMFB ChipsChip 3 Feedback measurements from 2024-02-18 and onwards

Example of valid file path:

O:Tech_PhotonicsProjectsNarrow LinewidthMFB ChipsChip 3 Feedback measurements Measurements_2024-02-222024-02-22_12-01-21single_measurement_ 2024-02-22_12-01-21_ESA_full_spectrum_, EOM off,feedback_-47.58 dB.txt

Parameters:

path (str) – Path of data file

Returns:

array of ESA frequencies powers: array of ESA powers in dBm

Return type:

freqs

plot(label='')[source]

Plot DSH spectrum :param label: Plot label. Defaults to empty string. :type label: str, optional

fit_profile(threshold_close, threshold_mid, threshold_far, plot=True)[source]

Fits DSH spectrum to a Gaussian about the center and a Lorentzian to the tails and extracts the FWHM from both

Parameters:

  • fs – Fourier freqencies, assumed to be centered about profile.

  • case (If this is not the)

  • frequency (set center = EOM modulation)

  • method. (in __init__ or use the set_center() class)

  • ps – ESA powers

  • threshold_close (float) – Maximum value from the center to make a Gaussian fit

  • threshold_mid (float) – Minimum value from the center to make a Lorentzian fit

  • threshold_far (float) – Maximum value from the center to make a Lorentzian fit

  • plot (bool, optional) – Plots data and fit. Defauls to True

Returns:

Gaussian FWHM, Lorentzian FWHM

extract_meas_params(path)[source]

A method to extract the measurement parameters used for a given spectrum. Argument: path

Type: str

File path

Returns: params_dict
Type: dict

A dictionary containing all the information saved in the header of the EOM on, peak range .txt file. The units used are most likely: meters, watts, volts, dB, MHz

class u_shaped_lib.load_data.laser_powers(directory)[source]

Bases: object

Class extracting laser and feedback powers from separate .txt files (containing all power readings in one file [compared to the other where it’s individual files]) Calculates variance and mean

u_shaped_lib.load_data.single_laser_powers(path)[source]

Works regardsless of using comma as delimiter or not.

Returns: laser power, time

Parameters:

path (str)

u_shaped_lib.load_data.get_single_measurement(directory)[source]

Updated version of get_single_measurement_paths Gets background subtracted DshSpectrum classes in full (160 MHz typ.) span and close (10/20 MHz tpy.) span as well as OSA spectrum if present

Parameters:

  • directory (Example) – Single measurement folder path.

  • directory

  • "O – Tech_PhotonicsProjectsNarrow LinewidthMFB Chips

  • measurementsMeasurements_2024-02-22 (Chip 3 Feedback)

  • 2024-02-22_12-01-21single_measurement"

Returns:

instance of DshSpectrum

DSH spectrum of the full span

dsh_close: instance of DshSpectrum

DSH spectrum of the close span

osainstance of OsaSpectrum

Full span OSA spectrum

Return type:

dsh_full

u_shaped_lib.load_data.get_lab_session_data(directory)[source]

Used to get data for all single measurements in a given lab session

Parameters:

  • directory (Example) – directory path for a measurement session.

  • directory

  • "O – Tech_PhotonicsProjectsNarrow LinewidthMFB Chips

  • measurementsMeasurements_2024-02-22" (Chip 3 Feedback)

Returns:

Array containing data for all single measurements

u_shaped_lib.load_data.get_SMSR_filtered_data(directory)[source]

Used to get data for all SMSR filtered measurements in a given lab session

Parameters:

  • directory (Example) – directory path for a measurement session.

  • directory

  • "O – Tech_PhotonicsProjectsNarrow LinewidthMFB Chips

  • measurements16-07" (Chip 3 Feedback)

Returns:

Array containing data for all single measurements

u_shaped_lib.load_data.get_SMSR_filtered_measurements(directory, result_directory)[source]

Method to extract spectra from the SMSR filtered data taken in a lab session.

Gets DshSpectrum classes in full (30 MHz typ.) span and close (2-30 MHz tpy.) span as well as OSA spectrum if present

Parameters:

  • directory (Example) – Single measurement folder path.

  • directory

  • "O – Tech_PhotonicsProjectsNarrow LinewidthMFB Chips

  • measurementsMeasurements_2024-02-22 (Chip 3 Feedback)

  • 2024-02-22_12-01-21single_measurement"

  • result_directory (str)

Returns:

instance of DshSpectrum

DSH spectrum of the full span

dsh_close: instance of DshSpectrum

DSH spectrum of the close span

osainstance of OsaSpectrum

Full span OSA spectrum

Return type:

dsh_full

u_shaped_lib.load_data.feedback_ratio(laser_power, feedback_power, laser_ref, laser_power_coef=1 / 40, coupling_ref=0.4, feedback_coef=1.0)[source]

The calculation of the feedback ratio using Simon’s derivation. It assumes initially a coupling of 0.4 between the laser and the fiber. The arguments could be taken from the header of each measurement (see ld.extract_meas_params method) laser_power_coef and feedback_coef depends on the setup, as it is the amount of splitting done before the power meters.
